skill.name: safe-edit
skill.description: Automatically backs up files, saves diffs, uses agents/skills, and ensures modular code (<200 lines) before any implementation. Use this skill for ALL code changes to ensure safe, reversible, and clean implementations.
skill.summary: Automatically backs up files, saves diffs, uses agents/skills, and ensures modular code (<200 lines)...
skill.author: Doyajin174

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation-based skill with no executable code. The markdown files define AI prompts/instructions for safe code editing workflows. All described operations (backups, diffs, rollbacks) are standard version control practices with no network access, no credential handling, and no code execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Automate Safe Code Edits with Backups
content.value_statement: Code changes can break things and be hard to reverse. This skill automatically creates backups, saves change diffs, and enforces modular code structure before every edit. Your code stays safe and reversible.
actual_capabilities: Creates timestamped backups in .backups/ directory before any code change
Saves git diffs to /tmp/diffs/ for change tracking and rollback
Warns when files approach or exceed 200 lines
Suggests modularization plans for large files
Documents rollback commands for every change
Automatically activates on code modification requests
limitations: Does not execute backups automatically - requires AI assistant to follow the workflow
Does not perform the actual code implementation
Does not integrate with external version control services
Does not enforce limits without AI assistant cooperation

use_cases.title: Safe code modifications
use_cases.description: Make changes with automatic rollback capability. Never lose original code again.

use_cases.title: Track all changes
use_cases.description: Save diffs for every edit. Review changes easily and revert when needed.

use_cases.title: Safe implementation workflow
use_cases.description: Follow a proven workflow. Create backups and track changes automatically.

prompt_templates.title: Simple edit request
prompt_templates.scenario: Make a small change to an existing file
prompt_templates.prompt: Use safe-edit to add a loading spinner to the dashboard component. Create backup, save diff, then implement.

prompt_templates.title: Feature implementation
prompt_templates.scenario: Add a new feature with analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Use safe-edit to implement the new pricing calculator. Use Explore agent to understand the codebase structure first.

prompt_templates.title: Large refactoring
prompt_templates.prompt: Use safe-edit to refactor EditorContainer. Plan modularization if it exceeds 200 lines. Create separate hooks and action files.

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix with rollback
prompt_templates.scenario: Fix a bug and ensure rollback is possible
prompt_templates.prompt: Use safe-edit to fix the TTS timing bug. Backup affected files, save diffs, implement fix, and provide rollback commands.

output_examples.input: Add a footer with links to the pricing page

best_practices: Always let safe-edit activate automatically for every code change request
Review diffs before applying changes to understand what will be modified
Keep backups for at least 7 days before cleanup
anti_patterns: Skipping backups for small changes - even tiny edits can cause bugs
Deleting backups immediately after successful implementation
Ignoring the 200-line warning - large files become hard to maintain

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Activates automatically on code modification requests.

faq.question: What happens if I need to rollback?
faq.answer: Three rollback options exist: restore from backup file, apply reverse patch, or use git restore command.

faq.question: How long are backups kept?
faq.answer: Backups remain until manually deleted. The skill documentation suggests cleaning backups older than 7 days.

faq.question: Does this skill access my credentials or secrets?
faq.answer: No. The skill only creates backups and saves diffs. It never reads environment variables, credentials, or keychains.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for non-code files?
faq.answer: Yes. The workflow works for any text file that needs safe editing with backup and rollback capability.

faq.question: How is this different from git version control?
faq.answer: Git tracks commits. Safe-edit creates immediate pre-change backups and diffs for every edit, enabling instant rollback without git operations.
